stanza.line: That time of year thou mayst in mebehold
When yellow leaves or none or few dohang
Upon those boughs which shake against thecold
Bare ruined choirs where late the sweet birdssang
In me thou seest the twilight of such day
As after sunset fadeth in thewest
Which by and by black night doth take away
Death second self that seals up all inrest
In me thou seest the glowing of such fire
That on the ashes of his youth dothlie
As the death bed whereon it must expire
Consumed with that which it was nourishedby
This thou perceiv which makes thy love morestrong
To love that well which thou must leave erelong
